3236    /**
3237     * A reasonably-fast hashing function that passes some of SMHasher's quality tests, but neither critically fails nor
3238     * overwhelmingly succeeds the full SMHasher test battery. This is the default used by methods in the
3239     * outer class like {@link CrossHash#hash(int[])}, which should be the same as {@link CrossHash.Hive#hash(int[])};
3240     * you should prefer using the outer class since this inner class is only here for reference. It may be replaced by
3241     * {@link Water} in the future; Water is drastically faster on int array inputs and does pass all of SMHasher, but
3242     * has minimal optimization for GWT.
3243     * <br>
3244     * This mixes three different algorithms: the main one is used whenever inputs or outputs are 64-bit (so, all hash64()
3245     * overloads and {@link Hive#hash(long[])} for long and double), a modification of the main one to perform better on
3246     * GWT (only used on hash() overloads, and only when inputs are individually 32-bit or less), and
3247     * {@link CrossHash.Jolt}'s algorithm for hash64() on boolean and byte data.
3248     * <br>
3249     * Speed-wise, the main algorithm is about 20% slower than Wisp, but in hash tables it doesn't have clear failure 
3250     * cases like Wisp does on some inputs (such as fixed-length Strings with identical prefixes). If collisions are
3251     * expensive or profiling shows that Wisp's algorithm is colliding at a high rate, you should probably use the
3252     * normal IHasher and CrossHash.hash() methods, since those will use Hive. The modified algorithm for GWT is a
3253     * little slower than the main algorithm in the C++ implementation that was used to check SMHasher quality, but it
3254     * may perform similarly to the main algorithm in Java on desktop platforms. Since it avoids creating longs or doing
3255     * any math on them, it should be at least 3x faster than the main algorithm on GWT (a GWT long is internally
3256     * represented by 3 JS numbers, so barring special optimizations it takes at least 3x as many math operations to use
3257     * longs there).
3258     * <br>
3259     * Its design uses two states like {@link Lightning} or {@link Wisp}, updating them differently from each other, and
3260     * bitwise-rotates one at each step. It combines the states (xorshifting one state, multiplying it by a huge
3261     * constant, and adding that to the other state) and then runs that through MurmurHash3's finalization function (its
3262     * {@code fmix64()} function; the main algorithm elides one xorshift at the end that proved unnecessary). Parts of
3263     * the code here are inspired by the design of {@link DiverRNG}, particularly its determine() method since both
3264     * use an XLCG (XOR Linear Congruential Generator, as PractRand calls it) as a processing step.
3265     * <br>
3266     * The name comes from the song I was listening to when I finally got the tests to pass ("Slave The Hive" by High On
3267     * Fire) and from the wide assortment of code that I had to employ to achieve a SMHasher successful run (which
3268     * turned out to be not-so-successful).
3269     * @see CrossHash Prefer using the hash() and hash64() methods in the outer class to this inner one; this inner
3270     * class is only here for compatibility and can be removed by minifiers if you don't use it
3271     */
3272    @Beta
3273    public static final class Hive {
3274        public static long hash64(final CharSequence data) {
3275            if (data == null)
3276                return 0L;
3277            long result = 0x1A976FDF6BF60B8EL, z = 0x60642E2A34326F15L;
3278            final int len = data.length();
3279            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3280                result ^= (z += (data.charAt(i) ^ 0xC6BC279692B5CC85L) * 0x6C8E9CF570932BABL);
3281                result = (result << 54 | result >>> 10);
3282            }
3283            result += (z ^ z >>> 26) * 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L;
3284            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xFF51AFD7ED558CCDL;
3285            return ((result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L);
3286        }
3287
3288        public static long hash64(final boolean[] data) {
3289            if (data == null)
3290                return 0L;
3291            long result = 0x1A976FDF6BF60B8EL, z = 0x60642E2A34326F15L;
3292            final int len = data.length;
3293            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3294                result ^= (z += (data[i] ? 0xFF51AFD7ED558CCDL : 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L));
3295            }
3296            result += (z ^ z >>> 26) * 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L;
3297            result ^= result >>> 25 ^ z ^ z >>> 29;
3298            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xFF51AFD7ED558CCDL;
3299            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L;
3300            return (result ^ result >>> 33);
3301        }

3305                return 0L;

3307            final int len = data.length;
3308            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3309                result ^= (z += (data[i] ^ 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L) * 0xC6BC279692B5CC83L);
3310            }
3311            result += (z ^ z >>> 26) * 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L;
3312            result ^= result >>> 25 ^ z ^ z >>> 29;
3313            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xFF51AFD7ED558CCDL;
3314            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L;
3315            return (result ^ result >>> 33);
3316        }

3402        /**
3403         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
3404         *
3405         * @param data  the char array to hash
3406         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
3407         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
3408         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
3409         */
3410        public static long hash64(final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
3411            if (data == null || start >= end)
3412                return 0L;
3413            long result = 0x1A976FDF6BF60B8EL, z = 0x60642E2A34326F15L;
3414            final int len = end < data.length ? end : data.length;
3415            for (int i = start; i < len; i++) {
3416                result ^= (z += (data[i] ^ 0xC6BC279692B5CC85L) * 0x6C8E9CF570932BABL);
3417                result = (result << 54 | result >>> 10);
3418            }
3419            result += (z ^ z >>> 26) * 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L;
3420            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xFF51AFD7ED558CCDL;
3421            return ((result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L);
3422        }

3446        /**
3447         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive), ending before end (exclusive), and
3448         * moving between chars in increments of step (which is always greater than 0).
3449         *
3450         * @param data  the char array to hash
3451         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
3452         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
3453         * @param step  how many elements to advance after using one element from data; must be greater than 0
3454         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
3455         */
3456        public static long hash64(final char[] data, final int start, final int end, final int step) {
3457            if (data == null || start >= end || step <= 0)
3458                return 0L;
3459            long result = 0x1A976FDF6BF60B8EL, z = 0x60642E2A34326F15L;
3460            final int len = end < data.length ? end : data.length;
3461            for (int i = start; i < len; i += step) {
3462                result ^= (z += (data[i] ^ 0xC6BC279692B5CC85L) * 0x6C8E9CF570932BABL);
3463                result = (result << 54 | result >>> 10);
3464            }
3465            result += (z ^ z >>> 26) * 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L;
3466            result = (result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xFF51AFD7ED558CCDL;
3467            return ((result ^ result >>> 33) * 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L);
3468        }

3599            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3600                result ^= (z += (((o = data[i]) == null ? -1L : o.hashCode()) ^ 0xC6BC279692B5CC85L) * 0x6C8E9CF570932BABL);
3601                result = (result << 54 | result >>> 10);
3602            }
3603            result += (z ^ z >>> 26) * 0x632BE59BD9B4E019L;

3617        public static int hash(final CharSequence data) {
3618            if (data == null)
3619                return 0;
3620            int result = 0x1A976FDF, z = 0x60642E25;
3621            final int len = data.length();
3622            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3623                result ^= (z += (data.charAt(i) ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
3624                z ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
3625            }
3626            result += (z ^ z >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
3627            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
3628            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
3629            return result ^ result >>> 15;
3630        }

3638                result ^= (z += (data[i] ? 0x6F51AFDB : 0xC3564E95));
3639                z ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
3640            }
3641            result += (z ^ z >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
3642            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
3643            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
3644            return result ^ result >>> 15;
3645        }

3662        public static int hash(final short[] data) {

3751        /**
3752         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
3753         *
3754         * @param data  the char array to hash
3755         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
3756         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
3757         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
3758         */
3759        public static int hash(final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
3760            if (data == null || start >= end)
3761                return 0;
3762            int result = 0x1A976FDF, z = 0x60642E25;
3763            final int len = end < data.length ? end : data.length;
3764            for (int i = start; i < len; i++) {
3765                result ^= (z += (data[i] ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
3766                z ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
3767            }
3768            result += (z ^ z >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
3769            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
3770            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
3771            return result ^ result >>> 15;
3772        }

3797        /**
3798         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive), ending before end (exclusive), and
3799         * moving between chars in increments of step (which is always greater than 0).
3800         *
3801         * @param data  the char array to hash
3802         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
3803         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
3804         * @param step  how many elements to advance after using one element from data; must be greater than 0
3805         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
3806         */
3807        public static int hash(final char[] data, final int start, final int end, final int step) {
3808            if (data == null || start >= end || step <= 0)
3809                return 0;
3810            int result = 0x1A976FDF, z = 0x60642E25;
3811            final int len = end < data.length ? end : data.length;
3812            for (int i = start; i < len; i += step) {
3813                result ^= (z += (data[i] ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
3814                z ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
3815            }
3816            result += (z ^ z >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
3817            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
3818            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
3819            return result ^ result >>> 15;
3820        }

3968        public static int hash(final Object data) {

3982            if (data == null)
3983                return 0L;

3985            long a = len;
3986            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3987                a += (data.charAt(i) ^ 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
3988                a = (a << 17 | a >>> 47);
3989            }
3990            a = (a ^ (a << 41 | a >>> 23) ^ (a << 17 | a >>> 47)) * 0xAEF17502108EF2D9L;
3991            a = (a ^ a >>> 43 ^ a >>> 31 ^ a >>> 23) * 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
3992            return a ^ a >>> 28;
3993        }

4115            if (data == null || start >= end)
4116                return 0L;
4117            final int len = end < data.length ? end : data.length;
4118            long a = len - start;
4119            for (int i = start; i < len; i++) {
4120                a += (data[i] ^ 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
4121                a = (a << 17 | a >>> 47);
4122            }
4123            a = (a ^ (a << 41 | a >>> 23) ^ (a << 17 | a >>> 47)) * 0xAEF17502108EF2D9L;
4124            a = (a ^ a >>> 43 ^ a >>> 31 ^ a >>> 23) * 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
4125            return a ^ a >>> 28;

4128        /**
4129         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
4130         *
4131         * @param data  the String or other CharSequence to hash
4132         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
4133         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
4134         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
4135         */
4136        public static long hash64(final CharSequence data, final int start, final int end) {
4137            if (data == null || start >= end)
4138                return 0L;
4139            final int len = end < data.length() ? end : data.length();
4140            long a = len - start;
4141            for (int i = start; i < len; i++) {
4142                a += (data.charAt(i) ^ 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
4143                a = (a << 17 | a >>> 47);
4144            }
4145            a = (a ^ (a << 41 | a >>> 23) ^ (a << 17 | a >>> 47)) * 0xAEF17502108EF2D9L;
4146            a = (a ^ a >>> 43 ^ a >>> 31 ^ a >>> 23) * 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
4147            return a ^ a >>> 28;
4148        }

4150        /**
4151         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive), ending before end (exclusive), and
4152         * moving between chars in increments of step (which is always greater than 0).
4153         *
4154         * @param data  the char array to hash
4155         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
4156         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
4157         * @param step  how many elements to advance after using one element from data; must be greater than 0
4158         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
4159         */
4160        public static long hash64(final char[] data, final int start, final int end, final int step) {
4161            if (data == null || start >= end || step <= 0)
4162                return 0L;
4163            final int len = end < data.length ? end : data.length;
4164            long a = len - start;
4165            for (int i = start; i < len; i += step) {
4166                a += (data[i] ^ 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
4167                a = (a << 17 | a >>> 47);
4168            }
4169            a = (a ^ (a << 41 | a >>> 23) ^ (a << 17 | a >>> 47)) * 0xAEF17502108EF2D9L;
4170            a = (a ^ a >>> 43 ^ a >>> 31 ^ a >>> 23) * 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
4171            return a ^ a >>> 28;

4295        public static long hash64(final Object[] data) {
4296            if (data == null)
4297                return 0L;
4298            final int len = data.length;
4299            long a = len;
4300            Object o;
4301            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4302                a += (((o = data[i]) == null ? -1L : o.hashCode()) ^ 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
4303                a = (a << 17 | a >>> 47);
4304            }
4305            a = (a ^ (a << 41 | a >>> 23) ^ (a << 17 | a >>> 47)) * 0xAEF17502108EF2D9L;
4306            a = (a ^ a >>> 43 ^ a >>> 31 ^ a >>> 23) * 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
4307            return a ^ a >>> 28;
4308        }

4320        public static int hash(final CharSequence data) {
4321            if (data == null)
4322                return 0;
4323            int result = 0x1A976FDF, run = 0x60642E25;
4324            final int len = data.length();
4325            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4326                result ^= (run += (data.charAt(i) ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
4327                run ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
4328            }
4329            result += (run ^ run >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
4330            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
4331            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
4332            return result ^ result >>> 15;
4333        }

4608        public static int hash(final CharSequence[]... data) {
4609            if (data == null)
4610                return 0;
4611            int result = 0x1A976FDF, run = 0x60642E25;
4612            final int len = data.length;
4613            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4614                result ^= (run += (hash(data[i]) ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
4615                run ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
4616            }
4617            result += (run ^ run >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
4618            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
4619            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
4620            return result ^ result >>> 15;
4621        }
4622
4623        public static int hash(final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
4624            if (data == null)
4625                return 0;
4626            int result = 0x1A976FDF, run = 0x60642E25;
4627            for (CharSequence datum : data) {
4628                result ^= (run += (hash(datum) ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
4629                run ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
4630            }
4631            result += (run ^ run >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
4632            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
4633            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
4634            return result ^ result >>> 15;
4635
4636        }

4638        public static int hash(final List<? extends CharSequence> data) {
4639            if (data == null)
4640                return 0;
4641            int result = 0x1A976FDF, run = 0x60642E25;
4642            final int len = data.size();
4643            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4644                result ^= (run += (hash(data.get(i)) ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
4645                run ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
4646            }
4647            result += (run ^ run >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
4648            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
4649            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
4650            return result ^ result >>> 15;

4653
4654        public static int hash(final Object[] data) {
4655            if (data == null)
4656                return 0;
4657            int result = 0x1A976FDF, run = 0x60642E25;
4658            final int len = data.length;
4659            Object o;
4660            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
4661                result ^= (run += (((o = data[i]) == null ? -1L : o.hashCode()) ^ 0xC3564E95) * 0x9E375);
4662                run ^= (result = (result << 20 | result >>> 12));
4663            }
4664            result += (run ^ run >>> 15 ^ 0xAE932BD5) * 0x632B9;
4665            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xFF51D;
4666            result = (result ^ result >>> 15) * 0xC4CEB;
4667            return result ^ result >>> 15;
4668        }
4669
4670        public static int hash(final Object data) {
4671            if (data == null)
4672                return 0;
4673            final int h = data.hashCode() * 0x9E375;
4674            return h ^ (h >>> 16);
4675        }
4676    }
4677
4678    /**
4679     * A fairly fast hashing algorithm in general, Water performs especially well on large arrays, and passes SMHasher's
4680     * newest and most stringent version of tests. The int-hashing {@link #hash(int[])} method is almost twice as fast
4681     * as {@link CrossHash#hash(int[])} and faster than {@link Arrays#hashCode(int[])}. Based on
4682     * <a href="https://github.com/wangyi-fudan/wyhash">wyhash</a>, specifically
4683     * <a href="https://github.com/tommyettinger/waterhash">the waterhash variant</a>. This version passes SMHasher for
4684     * both the 32-bit output hash() methods and the 64-bit output hash64() methods (which use the slightly tweaked
4685     * wheathash variant in the waterhash Git repo, or woothash for hashing long arrays). While an earlier version
4686     * passed rurban/smhasher, it failed demerphq/smhasher (Yves' more stringent fork), so some minor tweaks allowed the
4687     * latest code to pass Yves' test. Uses 64-bit math, so it won't be as fast on GWT. Currently, the methods that hash
4688     * types other than int arrays aren't as fast as the int array hash, but they are usually faster than the default
4689     * Hive implementation, and unlike Hive, these pass SMHasher.
4690     * <br>
4691     * These hash functions are so fast because they operate in bulk on 4 items at a time, such as 4 ints (which is the
4692     * optimal case), 4 bytes, or 4 longs (which uses a different algorithm). This bulk operation usually entails 3
4693     * multiplications and some other, cheaper operations per 4 items hashed. For long arrays, it requires many more
4694     * multiplications, but modern CPUs can pipeline the operations on unrelated longs to run in parallel on one core.
4695     * If any items are left over after the bulk segment, Water uses the least effort possible to hash the remaining 1,
4696     * 2, or 3 items left. Most of these operations use the method {@link #mum(long, long)}, which helps take two inputs
4697     * and multiply them once, getting a more-random result after another small step. The long array code uses
4698     * {@link #wow(long, long)} (similar to mum upside-down), which mixes up its arguments with each other before
4699     * multplying. It finishes with either code similar to mum() for 32-bit output hash() methods, or a somewhat more
4700     * rigorous method for 64-bit output hash64() methods (still similar to mum).
4701     */
4702    @SuppressWarnings("NumericOverflow")
4703    public static final class Water {
4704        /**
4705         * Big constant 0.
4706         */
4707        public static final long b0 = 0xA0761D6478BD642FL;
4708        /**
4709         * Big constant 1.
4710         */
4711        public static final long b1 = 0xE7037ED1A0B428DBL;
4712        /**
4713         * Big constant 2.
4714         */
4715        public static final long b2 = 0x8EBC6AF09C88C6E3L;
4716        /**
4717         * Big constant 3.
4718         */
4719        public static final long b3 = 0x589965CC75374CC3L;
4720        /**
4721         * Big constant 4.
4722         */
4723        public static final long b4 = 0x1D8E4E27C47D124FL;
4724        /**
4725         * Big constant 5.
4726         */
4727        public static final long b5 = 0xEB44ACCAB455D165L;
4728
4729        /**
4730         * Takes two arguments that are technically longs, and should be very different, and uses them to get a result
4731         * that is technically a long and mixes the bits of the inputs. The arguments and result are only technically
4732         * longs because their lower 32 bits matter much more than their upper 32, and giving just any long won't work.
4733         * <br>
4734         * This is very similar to wyhash's mum function, but doesn't use 128-bit math because it expects that its
4735         * arguments are only relevant in their lower 32 bits (allowing their product to fit in 64 bits).
4736         * @param a a long that should probably only hold an int's worth of data
4737         * @param b a long that should probably only hold an int's worth of data
4738         * @return a sort-of randomized output dependent on both inputs
4739         */
4740        public static long mum(final long a, final long b) {
4741            final long n = a * b;
4742            return n - (n >>> 32);
4743        }
4744
4745        /**
4746         * A slower but higher-quality variant on {@link #mum(long, long)} that can take two arbitrary longs (with any
4747         * of their 64 bits containing relevant data) instead of mum's 32-bit sections of its inputs, and outputs a
4748         * 64-bit result that can have any of its bits used.
4749         * <br>
4750         * This was changed so it distributes bits from both inputs a little better on July 6, 2019.
4751         * @param a any long
4752         * @param b any long
4753         * @return a sort-of randomized output dependent on both inputs
4754         */
4755        public static long wow(final long a, final long b) {
4756            final long n = (a ^ (b << 39 | b >>> 25)) * (b ^ (a << 39 | a >>> 25));
4757            return n ^ (n >>> 32);
4758        }
4759
4760        public static long hash64(final boolean[] data) {
4761            if (data == null) return 0;
4762            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;//seed = b1 ^ b1 >>> 29 ^ b1 >>> 43 ^ b1 << 7 ^ b1 << 53;
4763            final int len = data.length;
4764            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4765                seed = mum(
4766                        mum((data[i-3] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b1, (data[i-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b2) + seed,
4767                        mum((data[i-1] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b3, (data[i] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b4));
4768            }
4769            switch (len & 3) {
4770                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4771                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E37L : 0x7F4AL), b3 ^ (data[len-1]  ? 0x79B9L : 0x7C15L)); break;
4772                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L), b0 ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L)); break;
4773                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-3] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L), b2 ^ (data[len-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L)) ^ mum(seed ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E3779B9 : 0x7F4A7C15), b4); break;
4774            }
4775            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
4776            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4777        }
4778        public static long hash64(final byte[] data) {
4779            if (data == null) return 0;
4780            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4781            final int len = data.length;
4782            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4783                seed = mum(
4784                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4785                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4786            }
4787            switch (len & 3) {
4788                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4789                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b2, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4790                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, data[len-2] ^ data[len-1] << 8 ^ b4); break;
4791                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ data[len-2] << 8, b2 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4792            }
4793            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
4794            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4795        }
4796
4797        public static long hash64(final short[] data) {
4798            if (data == null) return 0;
4799            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4800            final int len = data.length;
4801            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4802                seed = mum(
4803                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4804                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4805            }
4806            switch (len & 3) {
4807                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4808                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4809                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4810                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ data[len-2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4811            }
4812            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
4813            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4814        }

4820            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4821                seed = mum(
4822                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4823                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4824            }
4825            switch (len & 3) {
4826                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4827                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4828                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4829                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ data[len-2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;

4835        public static long hash64(final CharSequence data) {
4836            if (data == null) return 0;
4837            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4838            final int len = data.length();
4839            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4840                seed = mum(
4841                        mum(data.charAt(i-3) ^ b1, data.charAt(i-2) ^ b2) + seed,
4842                        mum(data.charAt(i-1) ^ b3, data.charAt(i  ) ^ b4));
4843            }
4844            switch (len & 3) {
4845                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4846                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4847                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-2), b3 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4848                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-3) ^ data.charAt(len-2) << 16, b1 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;

4854        public static long hash64(final int[] data) {
4855            if (data == null) return 0;
4856            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4857            final int len = data.length;
4858            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4859                seed = mum(
4860                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4861                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4862            }
4863            switch (len & 3) {
4864                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4865                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-1] >>> 16), b3 ^ (data[len-1] & 0xFFFFL)); break;
4866                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b0 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4867                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3], b2 ^ data[len-2]) ^ mum(seed ^ data[len-1], b4); break;
4868            }
4869            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
4870            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4871        }

4873        public static long hash64(final int[] data, final int length) {
4874            if (data == null) return 0;
4875            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4876            for (int i = 3; i < length; i+=4) {
4877                seed = mum(
4878                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4879                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4880            }
4881            switch (length & 3) {
4882                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4883                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[length-1] >>> 16), b3 ^ (data[length-1] & 0xFFFFL)); break;
4884                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[length-2], b0 ^ data[length-1]); break;
4885                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[length-3], b2 ^ data[length-2]) ^ mum(seed ^ data[length-1], b4); break;
4886            }
4887            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (length ^ b0);
4888            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4889        }
4890
4891        public static long hash64(final long[] data) {
4892            if (data == null) return 0;
4893            long seed = 0x1E98AE18CA351B28L,// seed = b0 ^ b0 >>> 23 ^ b0 >>> 48 ^ b0 << 7 ^ b0 << 53, 
4894                    a = seed ^ b4, b = (seed << 17 | seed >>> 47) ^ b3,
4895                    c = (seed << 31 | seed >>> 33) ^ b2, d = (seed << 47 | seed >>> 17) ^ b1;
4896            final int len = data.length;
4897            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4898                a = (data[i-3] ^ a) * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
4899                b = (data[i-2] ^ b) * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
4900                c = (data[i-1] ^ c) * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
4901                d = (data[i  ] ^ d) * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
4902                seed += a + b + c + d;
4903            }
4904            seed += b5;
4905            switch (len & 3) {
4906                case 1: seed = wow(seed, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4907                case 2: seed = wow(seed + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
4908                case 3: seed = wow(seed + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(seed + data[len-1], seed ^ b3); break;
4909            }
4910            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ seed >>> 32);
4911            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4912        }
4913        public static long hash64(final float[] data) {
4914            if (data == null) return 0;
4915            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4916            final int len = data.length;
4917            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4918                seed = mum(
4919                        mum(floatToIntBits(data[i-3]) ^ b1, floatToIntBits(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
4920                        mum(floatToIntBits(data[i-1]) ^ b3, floatToIntBits(data[i]) ^ b4));
4921            }
4922            switch (len & 3) {
4923                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4924                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (floatToIntBits(data[len-1]) >>> 16), b3 ^ (floatToIntBits(data[len-1]) & 0xFFFFL)); break;
4925                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ floatToIntBits(data[len-2]), b0 ^ floatToIntBits(data[len-1])); break;
4926                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ floatToIntBits(data[len-3]), b2 ^ floatToIntBits(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ floatToIntBits(data[len-1]), b4); break;
4927            }
4928            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
4929            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
4930        }
4931        public static long hash64(final double[] data) {
4932            if (data == null) return 0;
4933            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4934            final int len = data.length;
4935            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4936                seed = mum(
4937                        mum(doubleToMixedIntBits(data[i-3]) ^ b1, doubleToMixedIntBits(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
4938                        mum(doubleToMixedIntBits(data[i-1]) ^ b3, doubleToMixedIntBits(data[i]) ^ b4));
4939            }
4940            switch (len & 3) {
4941                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4942                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-1]) >>> 16), b3 ^ (doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-1]) & 0xFFFFL)); break;
4943                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-2]), b0 ^ doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-1])); break;
4944                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-3]), b2 ^ doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ doubleToMixedIntBits(data[len-1]), b4); break;
4945            }
4946            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
4947            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);

4949
4950        /**
4951         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
4952         *
4953         * @param data  the char array to hash
4954         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
4955         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
4956         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
4957         */
4958        public static long hash64(final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
4959            if (data == null || start >= end)
4960                return 0;
4961            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4962            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
4963            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4964                seed = mum(
4965                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4966                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4967            }
4968            switch (len - start & 3) {
4969                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4970                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4971                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4972                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ data[len-2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4973            }
4974            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
4975        }
4976
4977        /**
4978         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
4979         *
4980         * @param data  the String or other CharSequence to hash
4981         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
4982         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
4983         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
4984         */
4985        public static long hash64(final CharSequence data, final int start, final int end) {
4986            if (data == null || start >= end)
4987                return 0;
4988            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
4989            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length());
4990            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4991                seed = mum(
4992                        mum(data.charAt(i-3) ^ b1, data.charAt(i-2) ^ b2) + seed,
4993                        mum(data.charAt(i-1) ^ b3, data.charAt(i) ^ b4));
4994            }
4995            switch (len - start & 3) {
4996                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4997                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4998                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-2), b3 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4999                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-3) ^ data.charAt(len-2) << 16, b1 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5000            }
5001            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5002        }

5004
5005        public static long hash64(final char[][] data) {
5006            if (data == null) return 0;
5007            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
5008            final int len = data.length;
5009            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5010                seed = mum(
5011                        mum(hash(data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5012                        mum(hash(data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5013            }
5014            int t;
5015            switch (len & 3) {
5016                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5017                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5018                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(data[len-1])); break;
5019                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-1]), b4); break;
5020            }
5021            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
5022            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
5023        }
5024
5025        public static long hash64(final int[][] data) {
5026            if (data == null) return 0;
5027            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
5028            final int len = data.length;
5029            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5030                seed = mum(
5031                        mum(hash(data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5032                        mum(hash(data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5033            }
5034            int t;
5035            switch (len & 3) {
5036                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5037                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5038                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(data[len-1])); break;
5039                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-1]), b4); break;
5040            }
5041            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
5042            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
5043        }

5105        public static long hash64(final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
5106            if (data == null) return 0;
5107            long seed = 9069147967908697017L;
5108            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
5109            int len = 0;
5110            while (it.hasNext())
5111            {
5112                ++len;
5113                seed = mum(
5114                        mum(hash(it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + seed,
5115                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
5116            }
5117            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
5118            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
5119        }

5170        public static int hash(final boolean[] data) {
5171            if (data == null) return 0;
5172            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5173            final int len = data.length;
5174            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5175                seed = mum(
5176                        mum((data[i-3] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b1, (data[i-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b2) + seed,
5177                        mum((data[i-1] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b3, (data[i] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b4));
5178            }
5179            switch (len & 3) {
5180                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5181                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E37L : 0x7F4AL), b3 ^ (data[len-1]  ? 0x79B9L : 0x7C15L)); break;
5182                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L), b0 ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L)); break;
5183                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-3] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L), b2 ^ (data[len-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L)) ^ mum(seed ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E3779B9 : 0x7F4A7C15), b4); break;
5184            }
5185            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5186        }

5292        public static int hash(final long[] data) {
5293            if (data == null) return 0;
5294            long seed = 0x1E98AE18CA351B28L,// seed = b0 ^ b0 >>> 23 ^ b0 >>> 48 ^ b0 << 7 ^ b0 << 53, 
5295                    a = seed ^ b4, b = (seed << 17 | seed >>> 47) ^ b3,
5296                    c = (seed << 31 | seed >>> 33) ^ b2, d = (seed << 47 | seed >>> 17) ^ b1;
5297            final int len = data.length;
5298            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5299                a = (data[i-3] ^ a) * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
5300                b = (data[i-2] ^ b) * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
5301                c = (data[i-1] ^ c) * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
5302                d = (data[i  ] ^ d) * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
5303                seed += a + b + c + d;
5304            }
5305            seed += b5;
5306            switch (len & 3) {
5307                case 1: seed = wow(seed, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5308                case 2: seed = wow(seed + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
5309                case 3: seed = wow(seed + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(seed + data[len-1], seed ^ b3); break;
5310            }
5311            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ seed >>> 32);
5312            return (int)(seed - (seed >>> 32));
5313        }

5350        /**
5351         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
5352         *
5353         * @param data  the char array to hash
5354         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
5355         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
5356         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
5357         */
5358        public static int hash(final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
5359            if (data == null || start >= end)
5360                return 0;
5361            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5362            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
5363            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5364                seed = mum(
5365                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
5366                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
5367            }
5368            switch (len - start & 3) {
5369                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5370                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5371                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5372                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ data[len-2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5373            }
5374            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5375        }

5377        /**
5378         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
5379         *
5380         * @param data  the String or other CharSequence to hash
5381         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
5382         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
5383         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
5384         */
5385        public static int hash(final CharSequence data, final int start, final int end) {
5386            if (data == null || start >= end)
5387                return 0;
5388            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5389            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length());
5390            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5391                seed = mum(
5392                        mum(data.charAt(i-3) ^ b1, data.charAt(i-2) ^ b2) + seed,
5393                        mum(data.charAt(i-1) ^ b3, data.charAt(i) ^ b4));
5394            }
5395            switch (len - start & 3) {
5396                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5397                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5398                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-2), b3 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5399                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-3) ^ data.charAt(len-2) << 16, b1 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5400            }
5401            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5402        }

5405        public static int hash(final char[][] data) {
5406            if (data == null) return 0;
5407            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5408            final int len = data.length;
5409            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5410                seed = mum(
5411                        mum(hash(data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5412                        mum(hash(data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5413            }
5414            int t;
5415            switch (len & 3) {
5416                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5417                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5418                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(data[len-1])); break;
5419                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-1]), b4); break;
5420            }
5421            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5422        }
5423        
5424        public static int hash(final int[][] data) {
5425            if (data == null) return 0;
5426            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5427            final int len = data.length;
5428            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5429                seed = mum(
5430                        mum(hash(data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5431                        mum(hash(data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5432            }
5433            int t;
5434            switch (len & 3) {
5435                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5436                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5437                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(data[len-1])); break;
5438                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-1]), b4); break;
5439            }
5440            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5441        }

5486                seed = mum(
5487                        mum(hash(data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5488                        mum(hash(data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5489            }
5490            int t;
5491            switch (len & 3) {
5492                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5493                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5494                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(data[len-1])); break;
5495                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-1]), b4); break;

5499
5500        public static int hash(final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
5501            if (data == null) return 0;
5502            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5503            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
5504            int len = 0;
5505            while (it.hasNext())
5506            {
5507                ++len;
5508                seed = mum(
5509                        mum(hash(it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + seed,
5510                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
5511            }
5512            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5513        }
5514
5515        public static int hash(final List<? extends CharSequence> data) {
5516            if (data == null) return 0;
5517            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5518            final int len = data.size();
5519            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5520                seed = mum(
5521                        mum(hash(data.get(i-3)) ^ b1, hash(data.get(i-2)) ^ b2) + seed,
5522                        mum(hash(data.get(i-1)) ^ b3, hash(data.get(i  )) ^ b4));
5523            }
5524            int t;
5525            switch (len & 3) {
5526                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5527                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data.get(len-1))) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5528                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data.get(len-2)), b0 ^ hash(data.get(len-1))); break;
5529                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data.get(len-3)), b2 ^ hash(data.get(len-2))) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data.get(len-1)), b4); break;
5530            }
5531            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5532        }

5534        public static int hash(final Object[] data) {
5535            if (data == null) return 0;
5536            long seed = -260224914646652572L;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
5537            final int len = data.length;
5538            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5539                seed = mum(
5540                        mum(hash(data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5541                        mum(hash(data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5542            }
5543            int t;
5544            switch (len & 3) {
5545                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5546                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5547                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(data[len-1])); break;
5548                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(data[len-1]), b4); break;
5549            }
5550            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5551        }
5552        
5553        public static int hash(final Object data) {
5554            if (data == null)
5555                return 0;
5556            final int h = data.hashCode() * 0x9E375;
5557            return h ^ (h >>> 16);
5558        }
5559    }
